oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Lester Moran
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Lester Moran (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lester Moran; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Lester Moran -- (00:42) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:47) Blind persons commercial spot hosted by Burt Bacharach -- (02:44) Ten Little Indians ([Unidentified]) -- (03:44) WEKA radio spot hosted by Phillips and an unidentified host -- (04:52) Unidentified fiddle tune (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (06:16) Take off the Guitar (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (07:28) Phillips introduces Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys and they discuss how the group came into reality -- (10:18) Moran performs an Ernie Egg Market radio spot -- (11:38) He's Gonna Have to Go (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (12:16) Moran discusses an upcoming election -- (13:00) Hello Darling (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (13:50) Moran reflects on his bandmate's injury -- (14:52) Church in the Wildwood (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (15:38) Unidentified fiddle tune [featuring Moran voiceover] (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (17:19) Moran performs a Hallmarks of Country Music radio spot -- (17:40) America's bicentennial celebration commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (18:42) Phillips inquires about some black soot he saw on his way to Moran's hometown; additionally, Moran praises Ernie Cupp and Burford -- (23:19) Wichita (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (23:55) Moran addresses the crowd of the Johnny Mac Brown High school -- (25:44) Hey Joe (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (26:33) Hal Linden performs a conservation radio spot -- (27:32) Cholesterol awareness commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (29:05) When the Warship Left Vanilla -- (32:20) Sixteen Tons (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (33:12) Phillips introduces Moran to reflect on his time working with the Statler Brothers, and Moran reflects on Wichita -- (37:03) Moran addresses a crowd that gets rowdy -- (38:16) Unidentified Swing Song (Robert Dolly Parton) -- (39:23) Moran introduces Wichita -- (39:54) Unidentified fiddle tune ([Unidentified]) -- (40:42) Moran tells a joke about a salesman -- (42:05) Keep on the Sunny Side (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (43:48) Forest fire prevention commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (44:47) Phillips asks Moran to reflect on attractive audience members, and both say their goodbyes -- (47:56) Honky Tonk Girl (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (49:32) Why Baby Why (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (51:29) Folsom Prison Blues (Lester Moran and his Cadillac Cowboys) -- (52:14) Moran says goodbye to his audience -- (52:23) Unidentified fiddle tune [featuring Lester Moran voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (53:48) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (55:46) Phillips introduces next week's guest: Hank Williams Jr. -- (55:53) Hank Williams Jr. recalls how the Grand Ole Opry had issues with a Hank Williams Sr.'s tune, among other stories about Williams Sr. -- (57:15) Lovesick Blues (Hank Williams Sr.) -- (1:00:07) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
